file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 29-10-22-04 - ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Electric Motor-Driven Pump Contactors. B. These procedures are applicable to the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 1 and Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 2. C. The Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 1 is installed in the RH Electrical-power control/ distribution box and the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 2 is installed in the LH Electrical- power control/distribution box. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CON- ALL 29-10-22-000-801-A TACTOR - REMOVAL ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CON- ALL 29-10-22-400-801-A TACTOR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 29-10-22 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-22-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CONTACTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the overhead panel, is set to OFF. (2) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag, on GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are set to OFF. (4) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag, on BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (5) Set the BACKUP pushbutton, on the overhead panel, to OFF. (6) Put a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag, on BACKUP pushbutton. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-22 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) To get access to the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 1 (RH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100), through the wardrobe. (8) To get access to the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor 2 (LH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the lifevest shroud assembly and remove the 223UZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (5). NOTE: Lift the locker to release the connector. (2) Remove the nut (8), washer (7) and electrical wire (6). (3) Remove the nut (4) and washer (3). (4) Remove the screw (2) and washer (1) that attach the fuse on the connection bar. (5) Remove the fuse. (6) Remove the four screws (9) and washers (10) that attach the contactor on the electrical-power control/distribution box. (7) Remove the electric motor-driven pump contactor (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-22 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Electric Motor-Driven Pump Contactor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 224 B C 223UZ 224NZ A DET. A ZONE 223 D D DET. B DET. C LEFT POWER CONTROL FUSE RIGHT POWER CONTROL (REF.) AND DISTRIBUTION BOX AND DISTRIBUTION BOX 1. WASHER 1 2. BOLT 3. WASHER 4. NUT 2 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 11. HYDRAULIC ELECTRIC PUMP CONTACTOR (K0164 OR K0165) 6. ELECTRICAL WIRE 7. WASHER 10. WASHER (4) 8. NUT 9. BOLT (4) 2 1 TORQUE: 4.0 - 4.4 N.m (35.3 - 39.0 lb.in) DET. D TYPICAL 2 TORQUE: 3.9 - 4.6 N.m (34 - 41 lb.in) EM145AMM290189A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-22 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-22-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ELECTRIC MOTOR-DRIVEN PUMP CONTACTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Electric Motor-Driven Pump contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 ELECTRIC MOTOR DRIVEN PUMP (EMDP) - OPERA- AMM TASK 29-10-04-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To apply the torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the electric motor-driven pump contactor (11) on the electrical-power control/ distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). (2) Install the screws (9) and washers (10) that attach the electric motor-driven pump contactor (11) on the electrical-power control/distribution box. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-10-22 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Connect the electrical wire (6) with the washer (7) and nut (8). (4) Use the torque wrench to torque nut (8) to 3.9 to 4.6 N.m (34.0 to 41.0 lbf.in). (5) Apply a drop of torque seal F-925 to the nut (8) as a check mark. (6) Put the fuse on the electric motor-driven pump contactor (11). (7) Install the washer (3) and the nut (4). (8) Use the torque wrench to torque nut (4) to 3.9 to 4.6 N.m (34.0 to 41.0 lbf.in). (9) Apply a drop of torque seal F-925 to the nut (4) as a check mark. (10) Install the washer (1) and screw (2) that attach the fuse on the connection bar. (11) Use the torque wrench to torque screw (2) to 4.0 - 4.4 N.m (35.3 - 39.0 lbf.in). (12) Apply a drop of torque seal F-925 to the screw (2) as a check mark. (13) Connect the electrical connector (5). NOTE: Lift the locker to connect the connector. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 223UZ or 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100), as applicable. (2) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the BACKUP pushbutton. (3) Set the BACKUP pushbutton to AUTO. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (5) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag from BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (6) Do the Operational Check of the Electric Motor Driven Pump (EMDP) ( AMM TASK 29-10-04-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-10-22 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
